intro: Cathartocarpus atteleh, commonly known as the red sandalwood, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody structure. The plant produces small, red berries that are used in traditional medicine. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to habitat loss and overharvesting, Cathartocarpus atteleh is considered a vulnerable species.
